translation: Collected Documents: The Sutra of the Hundred Conditions, Volume 7

source_sentence: 吳月支優婆塞支謙譯
translation: Wu Yuezhi Upāsaka Zhiqian Translation

source_sentence: 現化品第七
translation: the seventh category of manifestation

source_sentence: （六一）◎身作金色緣
translation: (61) â€œThe body is made of goldâ

source_sentence: 佛在迦毘羅衛國尼拘陀樹下。
translation: The Buddha was under the Nirgrantha tree in Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 時彼城中，有一長者，財寶無量，不可稱計，選擇族望，娉以為婦，作諸音樂，以娛樂之。
translation: An elder of incalculable wealth and possessions chose a man of great clan and fame, gave him a wife, and composed music to entertain her.

source_sentence: 其婦懷妊，足滿十月，生一男兒，身作金色，端政殊妙，世所希有，身有光明，照彼城內，皆作金色。
translation: When she was pregnant and had completed the tenth month, she gave birth to a boy whose body was made of gold, of marvelous appearance that was unmatched in the world, and which had a radiance that shone like gold throughout the city.

source_sentence: 時兒父母，見其如是，心懷歡喜，歎未曾有，召諸相師，占相此兒。
translation: When his parents saw him like that, they were delighted and praised him as unprecedented, and they summoned a fortune teller to read his fortune.

source_sentence: 相師覩已，問其父母：「此兒產時，有何瑞相？」
translation: After the fortune teller saw him, he asked his parents, "What was the auspicious sign of this child when he was born?"

source_sentence: 父母答曰：「此兒生時，身作金色，兼有光明。」
translation: The parents replied, "When this child is born, his body will be golden and have light."

source_sentence: 因與立字，名曰金色。
translation: They gave him the name Golden because of the letters they had created.

source_sentence: 年漸長大，體性賢柔，慈仁孝順。
translation: As he grew older, he was good-natured and gentle, kind and filial.

source_sentence: 聞世有佛在尼拘陀樹下，將諸親友，往詣佛所。
translation: When he heard that there was a Buddha in the world who lived under the Nirgrantha tree, he sent his friends and family to visit him.

source_sentence: 見佛世尊，三十二相、八十種好，光明普曜，如百千日，心懷憘悅，前禮佛足，却坐一面，佛即為其說四諦法，心開意解，得須陀洹果。
translation: Seeing the Bhagavān, with his thirty-two features and eighty beauties and his radiance shining like a hundred thousand suns, they were delighted at heart, saluted the Buddha's feet, withdrew to sit to one side, and the Buddha then taught them the teaching of the four truths.

source_sentence: 歸白父母：「我於今日，往到尼拘陀樹下，見佛世尊，神容炳耀，如百千日；又見比丘，諸根寂定，威儀可觀，我所願樂。
translation: He returned to his parents and said, "Today, I went under the tree at Nirgrantha and saw the Bhagavān, whose appearance shone like a hundred thousand suns, and I saw a monk whose faculties were calm and collected and whose manner was respectable, which I longed for.

source_sentence: 唯願慈愍，聽我出家。」
translation: Please have mercy on me and allow me to leave home."

source_sentence: 時兒父母，聞是語已，愛念子故，不能違逆，尋將佛所，求索出家。
translation: After hearing these words, the son's parents, who loved and cared for their son, couldn't disobey them and rushed to the Buddha's place to ask him to leave home.

source_sentence: 佛即告言：「善來比丘！」
translation: The Buddha then told them, "Well done, monks!"

source_sentence: 鬚髮自落，法服著身，便成沙門。
translation: With his hair falling off his beard and his Dharma robes on his body, he becomes an ascetic.

source_sentence: 精懃修習，得阿羅漢果，三明六通，具八解脫，諸天世人，所見敬仰。
translation: After diligently cultivating it, he attains the fruit of the arhat, the three kinds of insight, the six powers, and the eight liberations, which are seen and venerated by gods and humans.

source_sentence: 時諸比丘，見是事已，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: After they saw this, the monks said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此金色比丘，宿殖何福，生於豪族，身作金色，得值世尊，出家獲道？」
translation: What merit did this golden monk cultivate in the past that allowed him to be born into a wealthy family, have his body made of gold, meet the Bhagavān, leave home, and attain enlightenment?"

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告諸比丘：「汝等善聽！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks, "All of you, listen well!

source_sentence: 吾當為汝分別解說。
translation: "I will explain it clearly for you.

source_sentence: 乃往過去九十一劫，波羅[木*奈]國，有佛出世，號毘婆尸，教化周訖，遷神涅槃。
translation: Ninety-one eons in the past, there was a Buddha named Vipaśyin who appeared in the world, completed his teachings, and moved to spiritual nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 爾時有王，名槃頭末帝，收其舍利，起四寶塔，高一由旬，而供養之。
translation: At the time, a king named Pāṇḍu Maitreya collected his relics, built a four-jewel stūpa a yojana high, and made offerings to him.

source_sentence: 時有一人，值行見塔，有少破落，和埿補治，及買金薄，安鉆其上，發願出去。
translation: A man walking by then saw a little bit of the stūpa that had fallen apart, so he mended it with coarse material and bought gold to drill into it, and he vowed to leave.

source_sentence: 緣是功德，九十一劫，不墮惡道，天上人中，身常金色，受天快樂。
translation: Because of this merit, for 91 eons he won't fall into a bad destiny, and up in heaven among humans his body will always be golden and he'll experience the joys of heaven.

source_sentence: 乃至今者，遭值於我，身故金色，出家得道。」
translation: Even now, when I meet him, his body is golden, and he leaves home and attains the path."

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「欲知彼時鉆金薄人者，今現在金色比丘是。」
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "You want to know who among those who were drilling gold was the golden monk who's here now."

source_sentence: 爾時諸比丘，聞佛所說歡喜奉行。
translation: The monks who then heard what the Buddha taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: （六二）◎身有栴檀香緣
translation: (62) â€œThe body has the condition of the fragrance of sandalwood.â

source_sentence: 佛在迦毘羅衛國尼拘陀樹下。
translation: The Buddha was under the nyagrodha tree in Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 時彼國中，有一長者，財寶無量，不可稱計，選擇高門，娉以為婦，作諸伎樂，以娛樂之。
translation: In that country, there was an elder with wealth incalculable and incalculable, who chose a high gate, took his wife in marriage, and created various plays and music to entertain her.

source_sentence: 其婦懷妊，足滿十月，產一男兒，容貌端政，世所無比，身諸毛孔有牛頭栴檀香，從其面門出優鉢羅花香。
translation: When she was pregnant and had reached the tenth month, she gave birth to a boy whose appearance was unsurpassed in the world and whose pores were perfumed with the fragrance of oxhead sandalwood and whose face was perfumed with the flower of upaura.

source_sentence: 父母親屬，莫不歡喜，召諸相師，占相此兒。
translation: His parents and relatives were overjoyed, and they summoned a fortune teller to read the fortune of this boy.

source_sentence: 相師見已，問其父母：「此兒生時，有何瑞相？」
translation: After the fortune teller saw him, he asked his parents, "What auspicious sign did this child have when he was born?"

source_sentence: 父母答曰：「此兒生時，身諸毛孔有牛頭栴檀香，從其面門出優鉢羅華香。」
translation: The parents replied, "When this child was born, the pores of his body smelled of ox-head sandalwood, and from his face there came the fragrance of upoluṣa."

source_sentence: 因為立字，名栴檀香。
translation: Because of this, he was given the name sandalwood.

source_sentence: 年漸長大，體性仁和，見者愛敬。
translation: As he grew older, his physical nature was kind and gentle, and those who saw him loved and respected him.

source_sentence: 將諸親友而行遊戲，漸次往到尼拘陀樹下，見佛世尊，三十二相、八十種好，光明普曜，如百千日，心懷歡喜，前禮佛足，却坐一面，佛即為其說四諦法，心開意解，得須陀洹果。
translation: He took his friends and relatives out for play and gradually went to the foot of the nyagrodha tree and saw the Bhagavān, with his thirty-two features and eighty kinds of beauty and his light shining like a hundred thousand suns.

source_sentence: 歸辭父母，求索入道。
translation: He returned to his parents and sought to enter the path.

source_sentence: 父母愛念，不能違逆，將詣佛所，求索出家。
translation: His parents loved him and couldn't disobey him, so he went to the Buddha and asked to leave home.

source_sentence: 佛即告曰：「善來比丘！」
translation: The Buddha then told them, "Well done, monks!"

source_sentence: 鬚髮自落，法服著身，便成沙門。
translation: With his hair falling off his beard and his Dharma robe on his body, he becomes an ascetic.

source_sentence: 精懃修習，得羅漢果，三明六通，具八解脫，諸天世人，所見敬仰。
translation: After diligently cultivating it, he attains the fruit of the arhat, the three kinds of insight, the six powers, and the eight liberations, which are seen and venerated by gods and humans.

source_sentence: 時諸比丘，見是事已，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: After they saw this, the monks said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 今此栴檀香身比丘，宿殖何福，生便有香？
translation: "Now, what merit did this monk with the fragrant body of sandalwood cultivate in the past that gave rise to the fragrance?

source_sentence: 又值世尊，出家得道？」
translation: Was it again when the Bhagavān left home and attained the Way?"

source_sentence: 爾時世尊，告諸比丘：「汝等諦聽！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks, "All of you, listen closely!

source_sentence: 吾當為汝分別解說。
translation: "I will explain it clearly for you.

source_sentence: 乃往過去九十一劫，波羅[木*奈]國，有佛出世，號毘婆尸，教化周訖，遷神涅槃。
translation: Ninety-one eons ago, in the past, there was a Buddha named Vipaśyin who appeared in the world, taught and educated everyone, and left for nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 時彼國王，名槃頭末帝，收取舍利，造四寶塔，將諸群臣后妃婇女，齎持香花，入彼塔中，而共供養，踐蹋塔地，有破落處。
translation: The king of that country, named Pāṇḍu Mati, collected the relics, built a four-jeweled stūpa, and brought a group of ministers, their wives, and their daughters into the stūpa with flowers and incense to offer to him, trampling down the stūpa's floor and leaving it in a state of disrepair.

source_sentence: 時有長者，見此塔地有破落處，尋和好埿，用塗治之，以栴檀香，坌散其上，發願而去。
translation: When an elderly man saw the place where the stūpa had fallen apart, he found a good substance to coat it with and scattered sandalwood incense over it, made a vow, and left.

source_sentence: 緣是功德，九十一劫，不墮惡趣，天上人中，身口常香，受天快樂，乃至今者遭值於我，身口故香，出家得道。」
translation: Based on this merit, he won't fall into a bad destiny for 91 eons, will have a permanent fragrance on his body and mouth among gods and humans, and will be delighted by gods, even if he meets me now, so his body and mouth smell good and he leaves home and attains the path."

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「欲知彼時以栴檀香坌散地者，今香身比丘是。」
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "You want to know about the person who scattered sandalwood incense on the ground, that's the monk with the fragrant body now."

source_sentence: 爾時諸比丘，聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: The monks who then heard what the Buddha taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: （六三）◎有大威德緣
translation: (63) â€œThere are the conditions of great authoritative power.â

source_sentence: 佛在迦毘羅衛國尼拘陀樹下。
translation: The Buddha was under the Nirgrantha tree in Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 時彼城中，有一長者，財寶無量，不可稱計，選擇高門，娉以為婦，種種音樂，以娛樂之。
translation: There was an elder in that city who had wealth beyond measure, chose a high gate, took his wife in marriage, and entertained her with music of various kinds.

source_sentence: 其婦懷妊，足滿十月，生一男兒，身體柔濡，顏色鮮澤，端政殊妙，世所希有。
translation: When she was fully pregnant for ten months, she gave birth to a boy whose body was supple and moist, his color was lustrous, and his appearance was marvelous and unmatched in the world.

source_sentence: 父母親屬，見之歡喜，因為立字，名曰威德。
translation: His parents and relatives rejoiced at the sight of him, and he was given a name, Weide.

source_sentence: 年漸長大，柔和調順，見者愛敬，遠近信伏。
translation: As he grew older, he was gentle and docile, loved and respected by those who saw him, and was trusted by people near and far.

source_sentence: 將諸親友遊行觀看，到尼拘陀樹下，見佛世尊，三十二相、八十種好，光明照曜，如百千日，心懷歡喜，前禮佛足，却坐一面，佛即為其說四諦法，心開意解，得須陀洹果。
translation: He took his friends and relatives on a tour and observed them. When he came under the tree at Nirgrantha and saw the Bhagavān, with his thirty-two features and eighty kinds of beauty and his light shining like a hundred thousand suns, he rejoiced at heart, saluted the Buddha's feet, withdrew to sit to one side, and the Buddha then taught him the teaching of the four truths, opening his mind and understanding, and attained the fruit of stream entry.

source_sentence: 歸辭父母，求索入道。
translation: He returned to his parents and sought to enter the path.

source_sentence: 父母愛念，不能違逆，將詣佛所，求索出家。
translation: His parents loved him and couldn't disobey him, so he went to the Buddha and asked to leave home.

source_sentence: 佛即告言：「善來比丘！」
translation: The Buddha then told them, "Well done, monks!"

source_sentence: 鬚髮自落，法服著身，便成沙門。
translation: With his hair falling off his beard and his Dharma robes on, he becomes an ascetic.

source_sentence: 精懃修習，得阿羅漢果，三明六通，具八解脫，諸天世人，皆共敬仰。
translation: He diligently cultivated it and attained the fruit of the arhat, the three kinds of insight, the six powers, and the eight liberations, and was held in high esteem by gods and humans alike.

source_sentence: 時諸比丘見是事已，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: After the monks saw this, they said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 今此威德比丘，宿殖何福，身極柔濡，顏色鮮明，又為眾人所見敬仰，遭值世尊，出家得道？」
translation: What merit did this authoritative monk accumulate in the past, which made his body extremely supple and his color bright, and which made him admired by many people, meet the Bhagavān, and leave home and attain the path?"

source_sentence: 爾時世尊，告諸比丘：「汝等善聽！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks, "All of you, listen well!

source_sentence: 吾當為汝分別解說。
translation: "I will explain it clearly for you.

source_sentence: 乃往過去九十一劫，波羅[木*奈]國，有佛出世，號毘婆尸，教化周訖，遷神涅槃。
translation: Ninety-one eons in the past, there was a Buddha named Vipaśyin who appeared in the world, taught and educated everyone, and left his spiritual nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 彼時有王，名槃頭末帝，收其舍利造四寶塔，高一由旬，而供養之。
translation: At the time, there was a king named Pāṇḍu Maitreya who took his relics and built a four-jeweled stūpa a yojana high and venerated it.

source_sentence: 時有一人值行往到，見彼塔上，有諸萎花塵土坌上，即取萎花，拂拭使淨，還用供養，發願出去。
translation: When a man traveling there saw some withered flowers on the stūpa and dirt on it, he took the withered flowers, wiped them clean, returned them to make offerings, and vowed to leave.

source_sentence: 緣是功德，九十一劫，不墮地獄、畜生、餓鬼，天上人中，顏色奕奕，有大威德，受天快樂，乃至今者，遭值於我，故有威德，出家得道。」
translation: Because of this merit, for 91 eons he didn't fall into hell, the animals, or hungry ghosts; he was resplendent among men in heaven, had great dignity, and was made happy by the gods; and now, having met with me, he has the authority to leave home and attain the path."

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「欲知彼時拂拭花人，今威德比丘是。」
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "Would you like to know that the person who wiped the flowers was now the Bhikṣu Pratibhāna?"

source_sentence: 爾時諸比丘，聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: The monks then heard what the Buddha taught, rejoiced, and approved.

source_sentence: （六四）◎有大力緣
translation: (64) â€œThere are powerful conditions.â

source_sentence: 佛在迦毘羅衛國尼拘陀樹下。
translation: The Buddha was under the nyagrodha tree in Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 時彼國中，有一長者，財寶無量，不可稱計，選擇族望，娉以為婦，作倡伎樂，而娛樂之。
translation: In that country, there was an elderly man with wealth beyond measure who chose a noble family and married a woman who made music and entertained him.

source_sentence: 其婦懷妊足滿十月，生一男兒，骨節麤大，肥壯大力，父母見之，因為立字，名曰大力。
translation: When she was fully pregnant for ten months, she gave birth to a boy with large bones and a strong, robust body.

source_sentence: 年漸長大，勇健多力，無有及者。
translation: As he grew older, he was strong and powerful like no other.

source_sentence: 將諸親友遊行觀看，到尼拘陀樹下，見佛世尊，三十二相、八十種好，光明普曜，如百千日，心懷歡喜，前禮佛足，却坐一面，佛即為其說四諦法，心開意解，得須陀洹果。
translation: He took his friends and relatives on a tour and observed them. When he came under the tree at Nirgrantha, he saw the Bhagavān, with his thirty-two features and eighty kinds of beauty and his radiance shining like a hundred thousand suns, he was overcome with joy, saluted the Buddha's feet, withdrew to sit to one side, and the Buddha taught him the teaching of the four truths.

source_sentence: 歸白父母，求索入道。
translation: He then returned to his parents and asked them to seek entry into the path.

source_sentence: 父母愛念，不能違逆，將詣佛所，求索出家。
translation: His parents loved him and couldn't disobey him, so they went to the Buddha and asked him to leave home.

source_sentence: 佛即告言：「善來比丘！」
translation: The Buddha then told them, "Well done, monks!"

source_sentence: 鬚髮自落，法服著身，便成沙門。
translation: With his hair falling off his beard and his Dharma robes on his body, he becomes an ascetic.

source_sentence: 精懃修習，得阿羅漢果，三明六通，具八解脫，諸天世人，所見敬仰。
translation: After diligently cultivating it, he attains the fruit of the arhat, the three kinds of insight, the six powers, and the eight liberations, which are seen and venerated by gods and humans.

source_sentence: 時諸比丘，見是事已，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: After they saw this, the monks said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此大力比丘，宿殖何福，生則大力，勇健無敵，又值世尊，出家得道？」
translation: What merit did this powerful monk cultivate in the past that made him powerful in birth, courageous and invincible, and worthy of the Bhagavān, who left home and attained the path?"

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告諸比丘：「汝等諦聽！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks, "All of you, listen closely!

source_sentence: 吾當為汝分別解說。
translation: "I will explain it clearly for you.

source_sentence: 乃往過去九十一劫，波羅[木*奈]國，有佛出世，號毘婆尸，教化周訖，遷神涅槃。
translation: Ninety-one eons in the past, there was a Buddha named Vipaśyin who appeared in the world, taught and educated everyone, and moved to spiritual nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 時彼國王，名槃頭末帝，收取舍利，造四寶塔。
translation: The king of that country, then named Pāṇḍu Mati, collected the relics and built a four-jeweled stūpa.

source_sentence: 時有一人，在此塔邊，高聲唱言，集喚眾人，建立塔棖。
translation: At the time, there was a man who was at this stūpa and called out in a loud voice, "Summon the people and build a stūpa!

source_sentence: 發願而去。
translation: He made a vow and departed.

source_sentence: 緣是功德，九十一劫，不墮地獄、畜生、餓鬼，天上人中，常有大力，受天快樂，乃至今者，遭值於我，故有大力，出家得道。」
translation: Because of this merit, for 91 eons he won't fall into hell, animals, or hungry ghosts; up in heaven or among humans, he'll always have great strength and receive the joy of gods; and now, having met with me, he has great strength and has left home and attained the path."

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「欲知彼時唱喚眾人竪立棖者，今此大力比丘是。」
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "You want to know the person who called out to the crowd to stand up and praise him, this is the Vairocana monk."

source_sentence: 爾時諸比丘，聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: The monks then heard what the Buddha taught, rejoiced, and approved.

source_sentence: ◎（六五）◎為人所恭敬緣佛在迦毘羅衛國尼拘陀樹下。
translation: The Buddha was under the Nirgrantha tree in Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 我此頭上，有此寶珠，不能使去。
translation: Here on my head, I have this precious pearl that I can't use to get rid of.

source_sentence: 今者乞食，為人蚩笑。
translation: Now, I'm begging for food, and people laugh at me.

source_sentence: 願佛世尊！
translation: May the Buddha, the Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 見却此珠。」
translation: See off this pearl."

source_sentence: 佛告比丘：「汝但語珠：『我今生分已盡，更不須汝。』
translation: The Buddha told the monk, "Just say to the pearl, 'Now that my portion of birth has ended, I don't need you anymore.'

source_sentence: 如是三說，珠自當去。」
translation: Say it this way three times, and the pearl will leave on its own."

source_sentence: 時寶珠比丘，受佛教勅，三遍向說，於是寶珠忽然不現。
translation: The jeweled-jewel monk then was commanded by the Buddha to tell him three times, and the jewel suddenly disappeared.

source_sentence: 時諸比丘，見是事已，前白佛言：「今此寶珠比丘，宿殖何福，於其生時，頭戴寶珠，光踰日月，又值世尊，出家得道？」
translation: After the monks saw this, they said to the Buddha, "What merit did this Jewel-Jewel monk accumulate from long ago that, when he was born, he wore a jeweled pearl on his head, its light exceeded the sun and moon, and he met the Bhagavān and left home and attained the path?"

source_sentence: 爾時世尊，告諸比丘：「汝等諦聽！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks, "All of you, listen closely!

source_sentence: 吾當為汝分別解說。
translation: "I will explain it clearly for you.

source_sentence: 乃往過去九十一劫，波羅[木*奈]國，有佛出世，號毘婆尸，教化周訖，遷神涅槃。
translation: Ninety-one eons in the past, there was a Buddha named Vipaśyin who appeared in the world, completed his teachings, and moved to spiritual nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 時彼國王名槃頭末帝，收取舍利，造四寶塔，高一由旬，而供養之。
translation: The king of that country, then named Pāṇḍu Maitreya, collected the relics, built a four-jeweled stūpa about a yojana high, and made offerings to it.

source_sentence: 時彼王子，入其塔中，禮拜供養，持一摩尼寶珠繫著棖頭，發願而去。
translation: That prince then entered the stūpa, paid homage to it, made offerings, took a precious maṇi bead, tied it to his palm-leaf head, and vowed to leave.

source_sentence: 緣是功德，九十一劫，不墮地獄、畜生、餓鬼，天上人中，常有寶珠，在其頂上，受天快樂，乃至今者，遭值於我，出家得道，故有寶珠，在其頂上。」
translation: Because of this merit, for 91 eons he won't fall into hell, animals, or hungry ghosts; up in heaven among humans, he'll always have a precious pearl on his head, which will make him happy in heaven; and now, having met with me, he's left home and attained the path, so he has a precious pearl on his head."

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「欲知彼時王子者，今此寶珠比丘是。」
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "If you want to know about that prince, here's the jeweled monk."

source_sentence: 爾時諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: The monks then heard what the Buddha taught, rejoiced, and approved.

source_sentence: （七〇）布施佛幡緣
translation: (70) Conditions for Giving Offerings to the Buddha's Banners

source_sentence: 佛在迦毘羅衛國尼拘陀樹下。
translation: The Buddha was under the Nirgrantha tree in Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 時彼城中，有一長者，財寶無量，不可稱計，選擇族望，娉以為婦，作諸音樂，以娛樂之。
translation: In that city, there was an elderly man with an incalculable amount of wealth and treasure who chose a noble family and married a woman who made music to entertain him.

source_sentence: 其婦懷妊足滿十月，生一男兒，端政殊妙，與眾超絕。
translation: When she was fully pregnant for ten months, she gave birth to a male child whose appearance was so outstanding that he was beyond compare with all the others.

source_sentence: 初生之日，虛空中有大幡蓋，遍覆城上。
translation: On the day he was first born, there was a large banner in the sky that covered the city.

source_sentence: 時諸人眾，因為立字，名波多迦。
translation: That crowd of people then created a name for him, which was Bhadrakapilā.

source_sentence: 年漸長大，將諸親友出城遊戲，到尼拘陀樹下，見佛世尊，三十二相、八十種好，光明普曜，如百千日，心懷歡喜，前禮佛足，却住一面，佛即為其說四諦法，心開意解，得須陀洹果。
translation: As he grew older, he took his friends and relatives out of the city to play and went under the tree at Nirgrantha to see the Bhagavān, who had thirty-two features and eighty kinds of beauty and whose radiance shone like a hundred thousand suns, rejoiced at heart, saluted the Buddha's feet, and withdrew to stay to one side where he taught him the teaching of the four truths.

source_sentence: 歸辭父母，求索入道。
translation: He returned to his parents and sought to enter the path.

source_sentence: 父母愛念，不能違逆，將詣佛所，求索出家。
translation: His parents loved him and couldn't disobey him, so he went to the Buddha and asked to leave home.

source_sentence: 佛即告言：「善來比丘！」
translation: The Buddha then told them, "Well done, monks!"

source_sentence: 鬚髮自落，法服著身，便成沙門。
translation: With his hair falling off his beard and his Dharma robes on his body, he becomes an ascetic.

source_sentence: 精懃修習，得阿羅漢果，三明六通，具八解脫，諸天世人，所見敬仰。
translation: After diligently cultivating it, he attains the fruit of the arhat, the three kinds of insight, the six powers, and the eight liberations, which are seen and venerated by gods and humans.

source_sentence: 時諸比丘，見是事已，而白佛言：「世尊！
translation: After they saw this, the monks said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 今此波多迦比丘，宿殖何福，生便端政，與眾超絕；又於空中，有大幡蓋，遍覆城上；復值世尊，出家得道？」
translation: Now, what merit did this monk Bhadrakapilā produce in the past that made him born into a dignified position, transcending all others; and what was the great banner in the sky that covered the city; and what was the occasion for the Bhagavān to leave home and attain the way?"

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告諸比丘：「汝等諦聽！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks, "All of you, listen closely!

source_sentence: 吾當為汝分別解說。
translation: "I will explain it clearly for you.

source_sentence: 乃往過去九十一劫，波羅[木*奈]國，有佛出世，號毘婆尸，教化周訖，遷神涅槃。
translation: Ninety-one eons in the past, there was a Buddha named Vipaśyin who appeared in the world, completed his teachings, and moved to spiritual nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 爾時有王，名槃頭末帝，收取舍利，造四寶塔，高一由旬，而供養之。
translation: At the time, a king named Pāṇḍu Maitreya collected the relics, built a four-jeweled stūpa a yojana high, and made offerings to him.

source_sentence: 時有一人，施設大會，供養訖竟，作一長幡，懸著塔上，發願而去。
translation: After making the offerings, he made a long banner, hung it over the stūpa, and vowed to leave.

source_sentence: 緣是功德，九十一劫，不墮地獄、畜生、餓鬼，天上人中，常有幡蓋，覆蔭其上，受天快樂，乃至今者，遭值於我，出家得道。」
translation: Because of this merit, for 91 eons he won't fall into hell, animals, or hungry ghosts; up in heaven or among humans, he'll always have a banner covering him, and he'll be delighted by the gods; until now, when he meets me, he'll leave home and attain the path."

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「欲知彼時作幡者，今此波多迦比丘是。」
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "You want to know about the man who used to make banners, here's the monk Bhadrakapilā."

source_sentence: 爾時諸比丘，聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: Those monks who then heard what the Buddha taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: 撰集百緣經卷第七
translation: Compilation of the Sutra on the Hundred Conditions, Volume 7
